definitions: To punish (in order to bring about improvement in behavior, attitude, etc.); to restrain, moderate.; To make chaste; to purify.; To punish or reprimand for the sake of improvement; to discipline.; To render humble or restrained; to restrain or moderate.; Made chaste; purified; modest.; Chastised.
examples: After the scandal, the politician was chastened by public outrage.; The coach chastened the players with strict training.; The mentor chastened the student by pointing out mistakes.
